intro: Haplolophium dusenianum, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Haplolophium dusenianum is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
